faqs.question: What is St Gabriel Self Help Group?
faqs.answer: St Gabriel Catholic Church Self Help Group (SHG), Thome is the socio-economic arm of St. Gabriel Catholic Church, an outstation of Queen of Apostles Parish within Ruaraka Zone of CARITAS Nairobi. The SHG was established on 18th December 2011 and registered with Caritas on 21st February 2013.

faqs.question: What time is the St Gabriel Self Help Group office open?
faqs.answer: We are open for enquiries from Monday to Friday, 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM and the 4th Sunday of every month. We are closed on weekends and public holidays. You can also reach us via our phone number, 0718892506 during working hours, or you can chat with me and I'll answer you at any time

faqs.question: Who can become a member?
faqs.answer: Membership is open to persons who are 18 years and above, provided that person is of acceptable social and moral standards.

faqs.question: How much does membership cost?
faqs.answer: A new member will be required to pay Ksh. 1,000 and maintain a minimum share monthly contribution of Ksh. 600.

faqs.question: Is there a limit to how much I can save?
faqs.answer: No Member is allowed to contribute savings amounting to more than 15% of the total members' savings.

faqs.question: Can I transfer my savings to another member?
faqs.answer: Yes, a member can transfer part or all their savings to another member in same or different self-help group. You'll need to apply for transfer using the prescribed savings transfer form.

faqs.question: How do I withdraw from the group?
faqs.answer: A member may withdraw from the group by giving written notice of not less than 60 (sixty) days.

faqs.question: Can I open an account for my child?
faqs.answer: Yes, a parent or guardian can open an account on behalf of a minor, provided such parent/guardian is a member of the Group. The minor account is purely a savings account that shall revert to the minor on attainment of 18 years of age. The account earns dividends but cannot be used to take a loan, though it may be used to guarantee a loan for school fees or hospital bills for the minor only.

faqs.question: What are the loan eligibility requirements?
faqs.answer: Applicants must: 1) Be honest and trustworthy and demonstrate ability to pay the loan, 2) Have saved for 6 consecutive months prior to applying, 3) Apply for a maximum of 3 times their shares, 4) Not save more than 1/3 of their share capital to acquire a loan.

faqs.question: What is the interest rate on loans?
faqs.answer: Interest on the loan is 1% per month on a reducing balance.

faqs.question: What types of loans are available?
faqs.answer: Six types: 1) Development loans (max 60 months), 2) Business Loan (max 60 months), 3) Emergency Loan (max Ksh 100,000, 12 months), 4) Education Loan (24 months for post-secondary, 12 months for primary/secondary), 5) Agribusiness loan (max 24 months), 6) Church loan (for Catholic Churches only through Parish Pastoral Council).

faqs.question: Tell me about Development loans
faqs.answer: All-purpose loan granted to all members individually or to corporate to finance development projects. The loan must be fully guaranteed and has a maximum repayment period of 60 months.

faqs.question: What is a Business Loan?
faqs.answer: For purpose of financing trading activities of individuals and corporates. It can only be advanced to an ongoing business. This loan must be fully guaranteed and has a maximum repayment period of 60 months.

faqs.question: What is an Emergency Loan?
faqs.answer: For unforeseen circumstances e.g. sickness, natural disasters or accidents. This loan is taken at a maximum of Ksh 100,000, must be fully guaranteed and repaid within a period of 12 months. Corporate members are not eligible for this product.

faqs.question: How does the Education Loan work?
faqs.answer: It caters for school fees only and is disbursed after a valid school fees structure has been presented. The loan is disbursed via cheque to the institution directly and is limited to school fees only. It is repaid within a maximum period of 24 months for post-secondary education and 12 months for secondary and primary institutions. Must be fully guaranteed. Corporate members are not eligible.

faqs.question: What is an Agribusiness loan?
faqs.answer: For agricultural purposes aimed at promoting agriculture for food security, improved livelihoods and economic growth. The repayment period shall be limited to a maximum of 24 months.

faqs.question: What is a Church loan?
faqs.answer: Granted to Catholic Churches only through the Parish Pastoral Council. The loan shall be fully guaranteed and repaid as per the loan repayment schedule. Where the signatories of the church group changes, the terms of the loan will not be affected and the responsibility shall be transferred to the new Church council.

faqs.question: Can I refinance my loan?
faqs.answer: Yes, but you must have: 1) Repaid 70% of the existing loan, 2) Repaid according to the loan agreement, 3) Present detailed documents of an ongoing project/business and budget to justify refinancing. After refinancing, loan security will be paid on the gross amount of the new loan. The loan will have to be guaranteed afresh. Refinancing will be done only once at any given time.

faqs.question: How can I lose my membership privileges?
faqs.answer: Members shall lose privileges on the following grounds: i) Becoming dormant (four consecutive months of non-contribution in savings) - dormant accounts shall not earn dividends, ii) Member withdrawing shares either voluntarily or through loan offsets, iii) One is incapacitated, gross misconduct and bankruptcy, iv) One defaults on a loan.

faqs.question: What is the group's financial standing?
faqs.answer: As at 31st July 2023, the share capital stands at Kshs. 46 Million with average savings being Kshs.157,981. The group has invested Kshs. 30.3 million with Arch Dioceses of Nairobi in treasury bills and purchased shares for Kshs 2 million with CARITAS Microfinance Bank.

faqs.question: What is the group's motto?
faqs.answer: Save Regularly. Borrow Wisely. Repay regularly.

faqs.answer: A leading Christian based financial service provider committed to empowerment of its members.

faqs.question: What is your mission?
faqs.answer: To empower members by instilling a saving culture, provision of credit and investment opportunities through prudent mobilization and utilization of resources.

faqs.question: How successful is the SHG?
faqs.answer: The SHG has seen tremendous growth since its establishment in 2011. The SHG has adopted the pay-bill platform of receiving members' contributions and at least 95% of the members have embraced the new payment system which has resulted in increase in share contributions by members.
